conclusion: The missile accelerates vertically from rest with a = 10 g (g = 10 m/s²).

premise: The missile accelerates vertically from rest with a = 10 g.
conclusion: Net force upward: Fnet = m a = m (10 g).

premise: Thrust T is upward, weight mg is downward.
conclusion: T – mg = m (10 g) ⟹ T = 11 m g.

premise: T – mg = m (10 g) ⟹ T = 11 m g.
conclusion: The rocket motor produces a CONSTANT thrust of magnitude T = 11 m g.
After rising to 5,000 m the guidance system swings the exhaust so that the gas is expelled downward and to the right making an angle θ with the vertical such that cos θ = 1/11.
Because the thrust is opposite to the exhaust jet, the thrust is now directed upward and to the left with the same angle θ to the vertical.

premise: Thrust is directed upward and to the left with angle θ to the vertical.
conclusion: Resolve T into vertical and horizontal components: Vertical component Tv = T cos θ, Horizontal component Th = T sin θ.

premise: T = 11 m g and cos θ = 1/11.
T = 11 m g and sin θ = (2√30)/11.
Upward force = Tv = m g, Downward force = weight = m g.
Only force is Th toward the left (call the magnitude Fx): Fx = 2 m g √30.
